_header: I warn you everyone for ye should understand
Note:
Cf. Ransome (1889)
XRansome, Cyril. “The Battle of Towton.” English Historical Review 4 (1889): 460-6, 460.
Subjects: Towton (Yorks.), battle of; carols, political; historical poems
_description: The Rose of Rouen, a political carol on the Battle of Towton, Yorkshire (1461) — fifteen 5-line stanzas (aaaab) with refrain, ‘Blessid be þe tyme þat euer god sprad þat floure’ and burden: ‘Now is the rose of rone growen to a gret honoure / Therfore syng we euerychone I blessid be that floure’

TCD432.First Lines:
I warne you euerychone for shuld vnderstondeThere sprange a rose in
                    rone & sprad into englonde…
TCD432.Last Lines:
…And al þe reime of englond ioy of his crownyngþat
                    we may blesse þe tyme þat euer god sprad þe floure
TCD432.Editions:
Madden,  Frederick.
